content.description: Really enjoyable face climb on good rock with big, fun moves throughout.
content.protection: three bolts to a two bolt anchor
content.location: On the right side of the crag, between 'Black Gold' and 'Liposuction'

content.description: A surprisingly floppy start on huge positive holds to an upper crux right by the third bolt. Take a moment to search around. Either pull thin moves on sharp holds (closer to 10-) or find the hidden positive holds (5.9). One last burley move to the anchors to sweeten the deal. Best to clip the first bolt before starting up. A tumble down the hill would be hardly enjoyable.
content.protection: 3 bolts. Fixe super shut type anchors.
content.location: 1 gulley to the west (left) of the gulley with the powerlines. Right side of the gulley (Climber's right).

content.description: Really tough start followed by tough face climbing. We thought this was route was tougher than the grade. Some broken holds perhaps?
content.protection: four bolts to a two bolt anchor

content.description: Easy climbing with the crux at the top in the chimney.
content.protection: Trad with a two bolt anchor.
content.location: Obvious crack between 'Grand Finally' and 'Black Gold'

content.description: Fun and consistent face climbing with good hands and feet throughout.
content.protection: Four bolts to a two bolt anchor
content.location: To the right of 'Burn Notice'. This climb is to the right of the gully underneath the power lines.

content.description: Nice, chill romp on excellent rock. A nice option for a burgeoning leader.
content.protection: 4 bolts. Fixe super shut type anchors
content.location: Third bolted route west of the powerline gulley. On the opposite face (east facing) from Grateful Dead.

content.description: Really cool overhang a few climbs right of glens fave..Starts on 2 finger pockets than leads into a cool knee bar/bycicle to get the 3rd bolt
Really tough face climbing start to easier climbing above.
content.protection: Well protected with three bolts and a two bolt anchor.
content.location: On the East end of the crag, second to the last route on the end.

content.description: This is a great warm-up and a good way for getting the feel of the rock and moves at the Powerline Crag. Its a solid 5.7, but short.
content.location: Left-most cliff on the crag, 3rd bolted route on the cliff, just to the right of Belly Dancer 5.10+.

content.description: Lots of cool 5.8 moves up this right-leaning route. A lead-fall before the 2nd bolt would kind of suck on this one, but there are plenty of good holds.
content.location: Leftmost route on the Blue Wall (could be considered the main wall of the Powerline Crag). 4th bolted route from the left (big gap between 3rd and 4th).

content.description: Delicate moves through the start bulge to rest jugs and easy slab to the steep finish. Find the positive holds for a solid clip before pulling a satisfying roof move. There's a climb immediately to the left and another climb just to the right on the opposite face. Both look 5.9 to 10- ish.
content.location: Just west of the powerline gulley.

content.description: Face climbing with the crux near the roof at the top. Getting over the roof is way fun, with good hand holds.
content.protection: Four bolts to a two bolt anchor
content.location: To the left of the obvious crack climb 'On Call'

content.description: A couple slightly tricky moves off a large start ledge takes you past a chill slab to a mini roof dihedral with a deceptively enticing crack. Don't tunnel vision!Especially if missing the good holds, clipping bolt 4 would be stressful and a fall between bolt 3 and 4 would be unpleasant.
content.protection: 4 bolts. Fixe super shut type anchor.
content.location: Very first bolted line if approaching from the East. Far right of the crag

content.description: This is one of the longer routes on the Powerline Crag. Its a great route for the grade because it includes all elements of fun good climbing: strength and technique, jugs and crimps, etc..
content.protection: Bolts all the way up, great placement (its a Marty route of course)
content.location: Right in the middle of "Blue Wall", 4th route from the left. You can easily see/count the routes to locate the start of this one.

content.description: I felt like it naturally climbs to the left of the bolt line. Some steep moves on not so obvious holds before wrapping back onto the face and up to the anchors.
content.protection: 4 bolts. Fixe super shut type anchor
content.location: Far far left of the crag right next to a tree. Last bolted line.

content.description: Don't let the name mislead you, it's worth a spin! Similar to the climb just to the left. Slightly tricky getting off to the second crux bulge.
content.location: First bolted route west of powerline gulley.

content.description: REALLY tough face climbing start to easier climbing above. Is it possible that a hold popped off at the bottom?
content.protection: Four bolts to a two bolt anchor
content.location: To the left of 'No Preservatives Added'. This climb is to the right of the gully underneath the power lines.

content.description: Face climbing with solid hand and footholds. The final move to the lowering anchors is the crux and will take a bit of thought.
content.protection: Four bolts to a two bolt anchor
content.location: Between the crack climb 'On Call' and 'Short Stuff'

content.description: This route is tough right off the ground. I had to setup a toprope from the route just to the right (5.7 Hubcap). As far as I could tell, hang-dogging my way up it, Belly Dancer has 3 crux moves, right off the deck.
content.location: Its the middle route, of the 3 routes, on the far left cliff of the crag. Easy to find... there are no more real cliffs further left.

content.description: The Powerline Crag is a heavily forested limestone wall. The routes here are primarily short (30') sport routes with generous bolts and bolted anchors. The wall faces South and when you aren't climbing you can enjoy nice views of the Blue Ridge Reservoir
